Body: Thank you, But I am using esp826 module with arduino. And i am not aware of any Specific API. can u please give an example of what kind of API You are talking about. I am aware of socket.io, which has a concept of  rooms. where you can emit a particular event to one particular room. But can u enlighten me a little more about what APIs i can use for my situation with esp826 and arduino. to communicate with a Python Server(Django).

I'm confused about what exact IOT device you are trying to communicate with and where that device is relative to the software you are running?  Is this IOT device running on your Arduino?  And, is your software on the same Arduino as the IOT device (such that you're just trying to talk directly to the hardware of the IOT device)?  Or is the IOT device remote and you're trying to talk to a remote device?

I don't know which esp826 module you have, but here's one discussion of talking to it via a serial port: http://www.instructables.com/id/ESP8266-Wi-fi-module-explain-and-connection/step6/Talking-to-the-ESP8266/

The IOT device you are using should support an API for communicating with it - built into the device and hub it is connected to.  It is probably not using generic webSocket.  You should use the API that is specific for the IOT device and hub you are using.  In general you will communicate with the hub and the hub will handle the communication to the IOT device itself.
